cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast, expected to cross Florida’s Big Bend then move up the U.S. East Coast and pass offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Suwannee River–Mexico Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Marineland FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Suwannee River–Mexico Beach FL; Tropical Storm Warning Anclote River–Suwannee River FL and west of Mexico Beach–Destin FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend Gulf Coast, then Atlantic coast from Georgia through the Carolinas, Virginia, Delmarva, New Jersey and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (18%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) Sunday–Monday; gusty northeasterlies possible as the storm tracks offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat indicated for the Delaware River or upper Delaware Bay at this time.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible late weekend into Monday, but guidance does not yet show amounts exceeding 4 inches at Philadelphia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents on the New Jersey and Delaware coasts could disrupt vessel approaches and pilot transfers.
